ZCrypt is a project created by Clement and has been launched for the first time on February the 24th 2020
The goal of this project is to make encryption accessible to everyone and easy to use
For more than a year, ZCrypt has been a Python command line application that can run (almost) only on computers
So to better achieve ZCrypt\'s goal of accessibility, I decided to create an Android app to make it easier to interact with ZCrypt
ZCrypt can basically do two things : encrypt and decrypt a message
So basically, here is what you need to do to encrypt a message using ZCrypt :
1. Input the message you want to encrypt
2. Provide the name of the sender (should be your name) along with the receiver one\'s
3. And voila ! Encrypted content is stored on a file for which you can choose the name and location on your phone\'s storage
So now you might be wondering how to decrypt what you just encrypted. This is very simple :
1. Go to the decrypt tab and click on the decrypt button
2. Select the file which contains the encrypted content
3. And there it is ! A pop-up should appear containing everything you encrypted along with a timestamp
And this is pretty much it ! I hope you enjoy this app !
